newsitem.title: UK: NWE naphtha jumps $3 but arb to East stays shut.
newsitem.headline: NWE naphtha jumps $3 but arb to East stays shut.

text.p: NWE naphtha rose $3 a tonne on Tuesday, tracking firmer crude oil and good demand.
"The demand for good quality barrels in Europe is still there despite the closed arb to the East," said a refiner.
He saw high parafinnic or aromatic grades at $3.50 a tonne above the quotations but said there were some quality problems with Egyptian cargoes.

July swaps talked $176.50 by late afternoon with August at $179 and September at $181. Dealers said the market also enjoyed support from gasoline which climbed $3 a tonne in Europe ahead of an expected duty hike in the U.K.
